function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Delay in implementing adequate controlling measures","category":"Organizations","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of adherence to collective actions","category":"Leadership","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Inequality leading to social unrest","category":"Socio-economic","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate institutional trust","category":"Leadership","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Resistance to bottom-up planning and cultural preferences impacting environmental adaptation","category":"Leadership","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Detachment of people from the biosphere leading to difficulty in caring for nature","category":"Participation","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shift in worldview from technological utopia to dependence on ecosystems","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High hiv prevalence in specific provinces","category":"Person","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Age and marital status as predictors of hiv infection","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Spatial clustering of hiv cases in specific provinces","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of access to gynecologic oncologist specialists for rural women with ovarian cancer","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Disparities in referral rates for rural women with ovarian cancer","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Longer time from diagnosis to surgery for rural women with ovarian cancer","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of targeted, non-coercive community interventions","category":"Organizations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Incomplete or inaccurate communication from health authorities","category":"Leadership","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Conducting mass gatherings and events without restrictions","category":"Participation","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Institutional quarantining overwhelmed system leading to more infections","category":"Organizations","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Funerals conducted in homes leading to transmission of viruses","category":"Visitors","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Timing of community mitigation measures impacting effectiveness","category":"Organizations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Socio-economic and region-specific factors associated with the spread of covid-19 at an ecological level","category":"Socio-economic","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low socioeconomic status as a risk factor for contagious diseases","category":"Socio-economic","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inconsistent use of research evidence in informing decisions","category":"Leadership","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Top-down approach to decision-making with political and economic considerations taking precedence over research and health directives","category":"Leadership","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Disruption of health systems and economies","category":"Organizations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Relevant evidence may exist but decision-makers may be unaware or unable to interpret or apply it to their own context","category":"Leadership","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Decision-makers are influenced by numerous forces, including institutional constraints, political context, interest group pressures, and personal convictions","category":"Leadership","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Infodemics and fake news spreading at an unprecedented speed and reach, making it challenging to find trustworthy sources and reliable information","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of cross-sectoral dialogue and collaboration, leading to siloed approaches in public health crisis response","category":"Leadership","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of coordinated multi-sectoral actions to mitigate public health crisis impact","category":"Leadership","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of monitoring the effectiveness of prevention and mitigation measures during a crisis","category":"Leadership","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited capacity for evidence-informed policy-making in middle-income countries","category":"Leadership","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of trust in evidence and critical linkages between stakeholders","category":"Leadership","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Rapid response service may deliver low-quality evidence due to time constraints and urgency, leading to incorrect decision-making","category":"Leadership","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of flexibility and capability in kt platforms to switch to rapid response mode during a crisis","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient resources and funding for operationalizing the rapid response service, leading to delays and inadequacies in evidence provision","category":"Leadership","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Kt platform not providing trustworthy evidence during the pandemic","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure to educate and raise awareness in vulnerable groups about covid-19","category":"Participation","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of responsiveness to changing priorities and needs","category":"Leadership","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High level of uncertainty associated with a pandemic","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure to identify context-specific knowledge gaps and priorities","category":"Leadership","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of vigilance in monitoring changes in the health system and social media","category":"Leadership","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of clarity on roles and responsibilities for pandemic response","category":"Leadership","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure of top-down approach in achieving desired impact for covid-19","category":"Leadership","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Scarcity of research and scientific uncertainties during pandemics","category":"Organizations","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reliance on single case studies and observational studies as best available evidence","category":"Leadership","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on indirect evidence from related viruses like influenza, sars, and ebola for policy response","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on non-peer-reviewed sources for evidence","category":"Leadership","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Fragmentation of evidence base","category":"Leadership","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of transparency in evidence sources","category":"Leadership","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of coordination and integration of research, data, and expertise across stakeholders and sectors","category":"Leadership","confidence":"High"}]}
